meanings.definition: A supernatural creature in Islamic mythology, typically capable of granting wishes.
meanings.sent1: The djinn appeared in a puff of smoke, ready to grant the young boy's wish.
meanings.sent2: Legend has it that if you rub a magic lamp, a djinn will emerge to grant you three wishes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous djinn granted the wish for a mountain of candy, but forgot to mention it would all disappear at sunrise.
meanings.sent4: The djinn's ability to grant wishes is like having a magical vending machine at your disposal.
meanings.sent5: The children listened in awe as the storyteller described the djinn's power to make dreams come true.

meanings.definition: Plural form of djinni, another term for genie.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the djinn were a group of powerful beings who could bend reality to their will.
meanings.sent2: The djinn were said to dwell in hidden caves, waiting for someone to release them from their magical slumber.
meanings.sent3: The djinn gathered around the campfire, sharing tales of their adventures across the desert.
meanings.sent4: The ancient scrolls spoke of a time when the djinn roamed freely, granting wishes to those they deemed worthy.
meanings.sent5: The old man claimed to have seen a shimmering cloud of djinn dancing in the moonlight, their forms ever-changing.
